frameworks.name: Bloom's Taxonomy
frameworks.description: A framework for categorizing educational objectives into levels of complexity.

levels.name: Application
levels.description: Using new knowledge in practical applications.

levels.name: Evaluation
levels.description: Justifying a decision or course of action.

frameworks.name: SOLO Taxonomy
frameworks.description: A model describing levels of increasing complexity in understanding subjects.

levels.name: Uni-structural
levels.description: Simple and obvious connection, but limited understanding.

levels.name: Multi-structural
levels.description: Several related aspects, but they are seen as unrelated.

levels.name: Relational
levels.description: Integrated into a structure, understood in terms of its relevance.

levels.name: Extended abstract
levels.description: Generalized to new domain, reflecting on own understanding.

frameworks.name: Taxonomy of Significant Learning
frameworks.description: A framework for identifying significant learning experiences.

levels.name: Foundational Knowledge
levels.description: Understanding and remembering information and ideas.

levels.name: Application
levels.description: Skills in critical, creative, and practical thinking; managing projects.

levels.name: Integration
levels.description: Making connections between ideas, people, or realms of life.

levels.name: Caring
levels.description: Developing new feelings, interests, and values.

levels.name: Learning How to Learn
levels.description: Becoming a better student, inquiring about a subject.
